metadata.title: Small synthetic molecule as an activator for −1 ribosomal frameshifting S2

affiliation.institution: Helmholtz Institute for RNA-based Infection Research (HIRI)

abstract.text: Preparation of mRNA and 70S initiation complex for rapid kinetics …S6 Supplementary References.

Escherichia coli strain DH5α was used to amplify plasmid DNA. Oligonucleotides were purchased from Invitrogen. The compounds NCTn (n = 5, 6, 7, and 8) used in this study were synthesized as previously reported (1). Chemicals were from Roche, Sigma, or Merck. Radioactive compounds were from Hartmann Analytic. Ribosomes from E. coli MRE 600, fMet-tRNA fMet , Leu-tRNA Leu , EF-Tu, EF-G, and initiation factors were prepared as described (2-5). tRNA Gly , tRNA Lys , tRNA Val were prepared from total E. coli tRNA by consecutive column chromatographies on Sepharose 4B (GE Healthcare), Phenyl Sepharose (GE Healthcare), and DEAE Toyopearl (Tosoh Bioscience). Aminoacylated tRNAs were purified by reversed-phase HPLC on an RP-18 HPLC column (250 mm × 10.5 mm, Merck) equilibrated with buffer (20 mM ammonium acetate, pH 5.0, 10 mM magnesium acetate, 400 mM NaCl) using a gradient of 0%-15%) ethanol. Aa-tRNAs were precipitated with ethanol and dissolved in water; concentrations were determined photometrically by absorbance at 260 nm.

The dual-fluorescent protein constructs were prepared by essentially the same procedure above. A DNA fragment encoding EmGFP was amplified by PCR with a forward primer 5ʹ-d (GAG TCG ACG   TGA GCA AGG GCG AGG AGC TGT TCA CC) containing either the F-VPK, M1-VPK, or M2-VPK sequence were prepared by inserting the dsDNA fragment corresponding to each sequence between EcoRI and SalI sites of pCMVTnT_mito_mCherry_EmGFP as described above.

ref_spans.text: (GAG TCG ACG   TGA GCA AGG GCG AGG AGC TGT TCA CC)

body_text.text: We generated an MMTV slippery site variant with the NCTn-responsive downstream secondary structure. The spacing between the stimulatory elements was unchanged compared to the MMTV frameshifting site. The codon located two codons upstream of the slippery sequence was changed to AUG, which was used as the start codon for 70S initiation. The immediate upstream codon of the slippery sequence was changed to GGA (Gly). The slippery sequence AAC (Asn) codon was mutated to AAG (Lys). The codon following the slippery sequence UUG (Leu) was mutated to UUA (Leu).

The fill-in product was digested with SalI and NotI, and then inserted into SalI and NotI sites of pCMVTnT_rluc to generate pCMVTnT_rluc_3tag. The dsDNA fragments containing either the F-VPK, M1-VPK, or M2-VPK sequence were prepared by annealing two overlapping oligonucleotides and filling in the ends with Klenow fragment. The sequence of the oligonucleotides are as follow: Forward; F-VPK, 5ʹ-d(GGA ATT CAG CTG AAA ATT CAA AAA ACT TGT ACA GCC GCA GTG G)-3ʹ; M1-VPK, 5ʹ-d(GGA ATT CAG CTG AAA ATT CAA AAA ACT TGT ACA GCG GCA GTG G)-3ʹ; and M2-VPK, 5ʹ-d(GGA ATT CAG CTG AAA ATT CAA AAA ACT TGT ACA GCG GGA GTG G)-3ʹ and Reverse; F-VPK, 5ʹ-d(ACG CGT CGA CCA AAT GGG CCT TTT GAG TGC CGC AAG CCC ACT GCG GCT GTA C)-3ʹ; M1-VPK, 5ʹ-d(ACG CGT CGA CCA AAT GGG CCT TTT GAG TGC CGC AAG CCC ACT GCC GCT GTA C)-3ʹ; and M2-VPK, 5ʹ-d(ACG CGT CGA CCA AAT GGG CCT TTT GAG TCC CGC AAG CCC ACT CCC GCT GTA C)-3ʹ. The resulting blunt-ended fragments were digested by EcoRI and SalI

FIGREF1.text: -3ʹ and a reverse primer 5ʹ-d(AAG CGG CCG CTT ACT TGT ACA GCT CGT CCA TGC)-3ʹ, from pRSET-EmGFP (Invitrogen) as a template. The amplification product was digested with SalI and NotI, and then inserted into SalI and NotI sites of pCMVTnT TM vector to generate pCMVTnT_EmGFP. A DNA fragment containing a partial sequence of a mitochondrial localization signal was obtained by annealing two overlapping oligonucleotides (forward; 5ʹ-d(GTT GAG TTG GCA GGT GGC GGC CGC GGC GGC TGT GGG CCT GGC TCT GAC)-3ʹ and reverse; 5ʹ-d(GCC AGC GCA GCA CCC AAG GCA GCG CCT CCA GAG TCA GAG CCA GGC CC)-3ʹ) and filling in the ends with Klenow fragment. This fill-in product was used as template for PCR with a forward primer 5ʹ-d(TGC ACT CGA GCC ACC ATG GCT CAT CAT CAT CAT CAT CAT GGA CGG TTG AGT TGG CAG G)-3ʹ and a reverse primer 5ʹ-d(GAC TCT AGA GCA TGC GCG CCG CGG CCG CCG CCG CCT GGA CCG CAG CCA GCG CAG CAC C)-3ʹ to give a dsDNA fragment encoding a full length mitochondrial localization signal. The resulting product was digested with XhoI and XbaI and cloned into XhoI and XbaI sites of pCMVTnT_EmGFP vector to generate pCMVTnT_mito_EmGFP. A DNA fragment encoding a mCherry gene was amplified by PCR with a forward primer 5ʹ-d(ACA TGC ATG CGT GAG CAA GGG CGA GGA GGA TAA CAT S6 GG)-3ʹ and a reverse primer 5ʹ-d(GAC TCT AGA ATT CTT CTT GTA CAG CTC GTC CAT GCC GCC GG)-3ʹ, from pmCherry Vector (TAKARA) as a template. The amplification product was digested with SphI and XbaI, and then inserted into SphI and XbaI sites of pCMVTnT_mito_EmGFP vector to generate pCMVTnT_mito_ mcherry_EmGFP vector. The dual-fluorescent protein constructs

FIGREF2.text: is underlined, Stem I is indicated in bold): M1-VPK mRNA: 5ʹ…AUG GGA AAA AAG UUA UAA AGC GGC AGU GGG CUA GCG GCA CUC AAA AGG CCC A…3ʹ F-VPK mRNA: 5ʹ…AUG GGA AAA AAG UUA UAA AGC CGC AGU GGG CUA GCG GCA CUC AAA AGG CCC A…3ʹ A-VPK mRNA: 5ʹ…AUG GGA AAA AAG UUA UAA AGA AAC AGU GGG CUA GAA ACA CUC AAA AGG CCC A…3ʹ The mRNAs were prepared by in vitro transcription using T7 RNA-polymerase and purified by QIAGEN RNeasy Kit according to manufacturer's instructions. The experiments were carried out in buffer A (50 mM pH 7.5 Tris-HCl, 70 mM NH 4 Cl, 30 mM KCl, 7 mM MgCl 2 ) supplemented with GTP (1 mM) at 37 °C. To prepare initiation complexes, 70S ribosomes (1 µM) were incubated with a 3-5-fold excess of mRNA, a 1.5-fold excess of f[ 3 H]Met-tRNA fMet and a 1.2-fold excess of IF1, IF2 and IF3 each in buffer A for 30 min. Initiation complexes were purified by centrifugation through a sucrose cushion (1.1 M) in buffer A. Ternary complexes were prepared by incubating EF-Tu (2-fold excess over aa-tRNA) together with GTP (1 mM), phosphoenolpyruvate (3 mM), and pyruvate kinase S8 Table S1. The effect of NCT8 on frameshifting on M1-VPK, A-VPK, and F-VPK mRNAs. The translation efficiency in −1 frame and 0 frame (FS and NFS, respectively) were calculated from the end points of in vitro translation experiments shown in Figures 4C-D; the values are mean ± SD (based on at three independent experiments).

FIGREF3.text: Schematics of the mRNA constructs used in this study. (A) M1-VPK and (B) M2-VPK contain an NCTn-inducible pseudoknot sequence. (C) F-VPK was designed to form pseudoknot structure regardless of the presence of ligand and adopted as a positive control. (D) A-VPK contains AAA/AAA sequence instead of CGG/CGG and was adopted as a negative control. (E) SSM-M2-VPK has a mutated slippery sequence GCGCGCG instead of AAAAAAC. (F) PTC-M2-VPK has a stop codon at the end of Rluc gene.

FIGREF4.text: Western blot analysis of NCTn-inducible −1PRF. Effects of NCTn derivatives on the efficiency of −1PRF were analyzed by western blotting of the translation products of the mRNA containing: (A) M1-VPK or (B) M2-VPK sequence between the Rluc gene and a truncated Fluc gene.Translation was carried out in the absence or presence of 1, 5, and 10 µM of NCTn (n = 5, 6, 7, and 8) in a rabbit reticulocyte lysate (RRL) and protein products were analyzed using an anti-Rluc antibody.The -1PRF products were identified using a respective in-frame control mRNA (INFC).FE represents the efficiency of −1PRF calculated by dividing the amount of frameshifting products (FS) by the sum of FS and non-frameshifting products (NFS). EF (%) and SD were determined based on at least three independent experiments. The reproducibility of western blot analysis. Effects of NCT8 on the FE were examined three times independently. EF represents the efficiency of −1PRF calculated by dividing the amount of FS by the sum of FS and NFS (%). Identification of the translation products using epitope tags. (A) Schematic of F-VPK_3tag mRNA used in this study. In the F-VPK sequence, the stop codon UAA immediately downstream of the slippery sequence was changed to UAC to allow subsequent translation of the epitope tags. In addition, the adenine at position 14 was mutated to uracil to avoid the formation of a premature termination codon. These mutations were also introduced in M1-VPK and M2-VPK sequences. In vitro translation was performed with each mRNA in the absence or presence of NCT8 (10 µM), and the translation product was detected by western blotting using antibodies against (B) anti-HA tag, (C) anti-Flag tag, and (D) anti-PA tag. Cytotoxicity of NCTn derivatives on HeLa cells. Cell viability was determined by WST-8 assay after 24 h treatment of HeLa cells with varying concentrations of (A) NCT5, (B) NCT6, (C) NCT7, and (D) NCT8. Data are shown as the percent cell viability relative to untreated cells. IC50

FIGREF5.text: Effect of NCT8 treatment on transcriptional activation of Renilla and firefly luciferase genes. (A) Schematic of the CMV promoter deletion constructs used in the measurements. HeLa cells were transfected with each of the promoter deletion constructs, and (B) firefly luciferase activity and (C) Renilla luciferase activity were measured 24 h after addition of NCT8 at the indicated concentrations. Each data point represents the mean ± SD of four replicates. RT-PCR analysis of transcript level and splicing in cells treated with NCT8. (A) Schematic representation of the PCR primer positions and the primer sequences for Rluc-Fluc and GAPDH fragment amplifications. (B) Agarose gel electrophoresis of the RT-PCR product. HeLa cells were transfected with each of the constructs as indicated above gel images, and treated with NCT8 at 0, 0.1, and 0.3 µM. Total RNA was extracted and reverse transcribed to cDNA as described in the supplementary methods. PCR was performed using the primers listed above. Effect of NCT8 on -1PRF in HeLa cells. (A) Schematic representation of the dual luciferase constructs used in the experiment. The constructs contain M1-, M2-, F-, A-, SSM-M2-, or PTC-M2-VPK sequence (Figure S1, indicated as PK) placed between the Rluc gene and the Fluc gene. SS: Slippery sequence + stop codon. (B) Effect of NCT8 treatment on the Fluc/Rluc activity ratio. HeLa cells were transfected with the dual luciferase constructs and incubated with NCT8 at the indicated concentrations for 24 h. (C) Fluc and (D) Rluc activities were measured consecutively by using dual-luciferase assays. Error bars represent the SD based on at least three independent experiments. * and ** denote p < 0.005 and p < 0.001, respectively (Student's t-test).

FIGREF6.text: Effects of NCTn derivatives on −1PRF in HeLa cells. Effects of varying concentrations of (A) NCT5, (B) NCT6 and (C) NCT7 on the Fluc/RLuc ratio were evaluated by the dual-luciferase assay in HeLa cells transfected with the construct containing M1-VPK or M2-VPK sequence flanked by Rluc and Fluc genes. Error bars represent of SD based on at least three independent experiments.

FIGREF7.text: Effects of NCD on −1PRF in HeLa cells. (A) The chemical structure of a control compound, Naphthyridine Carbamate Dimer (NCD). (B) Effects of NCD on the Fluc/Rluc ratio were evaluated by the dual-luciferase assay in HeLa cells transfected with the construct containing M1-VPK or M2-VPK sequence flanked by Rluc and Fluc genes. Error bars represent SD based on at least three independent experiments. Effects of NCT8 on −1PRF in HEK293 cells. Effects of varying concentration of NCT8 on the Fluc/RLuc ratio were evaluated by the dual-luciferase assay in HEK293 cells transfected with the construct containing M1-VPK (light blue), M2-VPK (magenta), F-VPK (gray) or A-VPK (green) sequence. Error bars represent SD based on at least three independent experiments.

FIGREF8.text: Effects of NCT8 on expression of the fluorescent proteins in mitochondria. HeLa cells transfected with the dual-fluorescence reporter constructs carrying M1-, M2-, or F-VPK were incubated in the absence or presence of 0.1 µM NCT8 for 24 h, and the translation products were visualized using a confocal laser scanning microscope. Box plot representing the distribution of the (A) EmGFP and (B) mCherry fluorescence in mitochondria. The images in Figures 7B-D were analyzed and the intensity of each fluorescent protein was quantified using IN Cell Investigator 1.6 (GE Healthcare). Error bars represent SD based on 100 cells from each sample.

TABREF0.text: Rate constants of FS and NFS peptide incorporations on M1-VPK, A-VPK, and F-VPK.Rate constants of FS and NFS peptide synthesis were determined by exponential fitting of the data shown inFigure 5A-F; error bars are SEM of the fit.
